cause.description:
Trichotillomania is a compulsive hair-pulling disorder that has physical and psychological effects. Hair-pullers commonly experience feelings of shame, embarrassment, low self-esteem, and depression. Repeated pulling can cause permanent hair loss. Friends and family of trichsters have trouble understanding the disorder and often do not show proper support to the individual.
1. Hair-care professionals, friends and family of trichsters should be educated on how to approach and show support to the individual.
2. Parents should be aware of this condition to look out for it, as it often begins in early childhood.
3. Continue research to find causes and treatments.
cause.mission: To educate the public about trich.
cause.name: Trichotillomania Awareness
